alert.note: Alert for Central Ventura County Valleys; Lake Casitas; Ojai Valley; Santa Susana Mountains; Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Southern Ventura County Mountains; Ventura County Beaches; Ventura County Inland Coast; Western Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 15 at 4:53AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Ventura County. * WHEN...Until 8 AM PDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers is possible. Rivers and creeks that may be affected include the Ventura River, San Antonio Creek, Calleguas Creek, Matilija Creek, and Conejo Creek. There may be mudslides and rockslides, especially in and near steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A powerful winter storm was bringing heavy rain to the watch area. Rainfall totals of 2 to 4 inches have been reported in many areas, and some additional rain is expected early this morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
